intro: Koeleria eriostachya var. pyrenaica, commonly known as the Pyrenean Koeleria, is a flowering plant native to the Pyrenees mountain range. It is a member of the grass family, Poaceae, and typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. The plant features slender, upright stems with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its small, blue to purple flower heads appear in late summer, contributing to its ornamental value. It is often found in open, sunny habitats at high elevations.
